table-reference.title: Continuous wire barrier constructionâ€”Minimum required tension (N) for vertical or near-vertical stainless steel wires where the maximum clear spacing between the rails is 900mm

ol.li: Lay = number of strands by the number of individual wires in each strand. For example a lay of 7 x 19 consists of 7 strands with 19 individual wires in each strand.
Vertical wires must have two pulley blocks to each 180 degree change of direction in the wire.
Near vertical wires may only require one pulley block for each change of direction.
Wire tension measured with a strain indicator.
The table only includes 7 x 7 and 7 x 19 wires due to other wires not having sufficient flexibility to make the necessary turns.
